intro: Melicope sudestica, commonly known as the Southeastern Melicope, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
